{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fetal lung maturity is a crucial factor in determining the viability of a preterm fetus. It can be assessed by several tests. A Lecithin/Sphingomyelin ratio greater than 2, a positive shake test, and increased phosphatidyl glycerol all indicate fetal lung maturity. However, the presence of blue cells in the Nile Blue Test does not indicate fetal lung maturity. Instead, it is a test used to identify neutral lipids and acidic phospholipids.", "answer_choice": "D"}
